text: The sphinxes do tend to look pretty masculine

To my knowledge, the angels-are-exclusively-female rule has been broken on two occasions: Malach of the Dawn in Planar Chaos (because Planar Chaos), and the Amonkhet angels (since they are creations of Nicol Bolas and not a naturally-occurring phenomenon)
No female demons thus far, though.
<@U3QMCLQQG> Do you mean literally call the column that or just write one about it? Cause that's basically what my articles do XD
Literally call a column that.
Aren't all MTG angels creations and not naturally occuring?
As opposed to 'real' angels?
No, but lol
As in aren't they all artificially created beings vs. however the hell else life appears on a specific plane?
Looks like they're kind of a thing that spontaneously generates from white mana OR can be created a la Avacyn
Nothing was ever said about the angels on Amonkeht or Kaladesh
[[Brand of Ill Omen]]

attachments.text:
Enchantment — Aura
Enchant creature
Cumulative upkeep {R} _(At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)_

text: Angels are basically golems in mtg
Which is dumb
Don't tell the tiki torch brigade!
They'll start protesting MTG and chanting blood and soil
Heh. Some guy from a smaller town around Rochester was marching in that rally with a torch so now that he's been doxxed there's a whole shitstorm
good
fuck him
Yup
I take some solace in the MTG community having been, without exception in my direct experiences, extremely welcoming and open-minded.
With the exception of mtgheadquarters
Fuck that guy.

It's a bit bizarre considering how many redpill-style bros seem to exist in other gaming subcultures, but yeah, aside from that tool my experiences with MTG folks have been resoundingly positive regarding inclusion, etc.
GP Richmond was like a mini pride event. Very heartening.

To an earlier point, something was actually said about the angels on Amonkhet. They're all male because it amplifies the unusualness of the plane. Bolas corrupted everything, so the angels were all male to make players feel like something was different and dangerous.
They do feel domineering for that reason, imo
Gabriel Angelfire is male
I assume
He is but that wasn't intentional, he wasn't supposed to be an angel
The artist assumed he was from the name and nobody cared because his type was Legend
Let's get really existential...do angels really have a sex? Is the implication that they can reproduce?
How many angels can dance on the head of a pin, though?
Basically they made him an angel retroactively during that creature type change whenever that happened just because he looked like one and it would be confusing otherwise
How big is the pin?
Also...never known angels to be great hoofers
A normal-sized pin, of course.
Normal to a hill giant...?
Quit putting your sizist values onto everything, <@U3QMCLQQG>
<@U3L7A68JC> Not that it matters, or that I've thought about it, but I'd assume they're anatomically correct where it matters given they are visually everywhere else.
To a non-Giant Growth'd human
<@U4V5EHQ2G> - I wouldn't make that assumption.
They're all smooth. No nips, either.
<@U3QMCLQQG> peeked
He erased the clothes off one of his cards...
Do they have belly buttons?
<@U32LRG9NU> on a scale of 0-raging hardon how much do you love [[Expropriate]]?

attachments.fallback: Expropriate {7}{U}{U} // Sorcery // Council's dilemma — Starting with you, each player votes for time or money. For each time vote, take an extra turn after this one. For each money vote, choose a permanent owned by the voter and gain control of it. Exile Expropriate.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
_Council's dilemma_ — Starting with you, each player votes for time or money. For each time vote, take an extra turn after this one. For each money vote, choose a permanent owned by the voter and gain control of it. Exile Expropriate.
_Few things are more valuable than time or money—and Leovold has plenty of both._
attachments.title: Expropriate {7}{U}{U}

text: Just seems weird to be so antomically correct everywhere else
Right now it's Schrödinger's Penis.
lol
They have vestigial ass cheeks, but they don't poop.
Plenty have navels so whatever force makes them is cool with making at least one extraneous body party that serves no purpose
(BTW, that's what ancient theologians really debated about- whether or not angels defecate- not about how many could dance on the head of a pin.)
Sucks Basandra is so bad, the art on that card is fantastic
Sure - he saved all that ink on clothes...
I err on the side that allows for theologically sound holy shit.
I will say...many angels seem to shop at Fredrick's of Hollywood.
I like Basandra. She flies  (pun intended) under the radar and can create some really bad situations for the opponent.
Perhaps there is a lot of clubbing in Heaven...
@dean...is that where we get holy shit?
It's certainly possible.
Normally I'd find a male gazy nature of a lot of the angels a little gross, but that's Terese Neilson art.
But it could be tied to Jesus and the debate over whether he was God, man, or both. Because if he was a man he definitely shit.
Hypostatic Union being the most commonly embraced doctrine of Christ means that most Christians do believe in holy shit. Whether they realize it or not.
Interesting tidbit from the release notes regarding multiple [[Alms Collector]]'s in play:

attachments.fallback: Alms Collector {3}{W} // Creature — Cat Cleric // Flash // If an opponent would draw two or more cards, instead you and that player each draw a card. // 3/4
attachments.text:
Creature — Cat Cleric
Flash
If an opponent would draw two or more cards, instead you and that player each draw a card.
_"There is no justice when some profit and others go without."_
*3/4*
attachments.title: Alms Collector {3}{W}

text: "If two players each control an Alms Collector and a third player would draw two or more cards, the third player chooses which Alms Collector's replacement effect will apply, and therefore which of the first two players draws a card."
Also interesting tidbit about _Crew_ with Marisil:
`If Mairsil has a crew ability, creatures can crew Mairsil. It'll become an artifact creature, but its power and toughness remain unchanged.`
So it actually becomes an artifact creature...
Also interesting distinction for Mathas:

If something doubles the number of bounty counters Mathas puts on a creature (ala Doubling Season), the second bounty counter does NOT have the triggered ability. However, if his ability is duplicated, such as via Strionic or Panharmonicon, then the creature has two separate counters with the triggered ability and if it does, it triggers twice.
Hmm
Circling back to the [[Path of Ancestry]] discussion. Since the card specifies mana of any _color_, it won't produce colorless mana for Kozilek, etc.

attachments.fallback: Path of Ancestry // Land // Path of Ancestry enters the battlefield tapped. // // {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color in your commander's color identity. When that mana is spent to cast a creature spell that shares a creature type with your commander, scry 1.
attachments.text:
Land
Path of Ancestry enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color in your commander's color identity. When that mana is spent to cast a creature spell that shares a creature type with your commander, scry 1.
attachments.title: Path of Ancestry

He's really cool.

The flavor is really on point for him, and I couldn't be happier that they are dipping way back into the archives of the Mtg lore and representing characters that were referenced in the old flavor text.

text: It's an odd hug-ish card...
Yeah, it kinda cool. A little different.
Naturally it would only go in very specific decks, but it isn't completely terrible. I mean on the surface it seems that way, but I suspect ther are some fun use cases
Also, making people spend lots of mana to draw card at their draw phase only isn't terrible. It's tricky to evaluate exactly what to do that early in a turn.
Actually, if you can stop people from drawing cards, it gives them a way out, but forces them to spend their mana...
Yup. Draw cards, or cast spells. What'll it be?
Whoa...WotC adding in a little flavor to the rulings under [[Vindictive Lich]]:

attachments.fallback: Vindictive Lich {3}{B} // Creature — Zombie Wizard // When Vindictive Lich dies, choose one or more. Each mode must target a different player. // // • Target opponent sacrifices a creature. // • Target opponent discards two cards. // • Target opponent loses 5 life. // 4/1
attachments.text:
Creature — Zombie Wizard
When Vindictive Lich dies, choose one or more. Each mode must target a different player.

• Target opponent sacrifices a creature.
• Target opponent discards two cards.
• Target opponent loses 5 life.
_Heart, mind, soul—weapons all._
*4/1*
attachments.title: Vindictive Lich {3}{B}

text: `You don't have to choose a mode for each opponent. For example, you could make one opponent lose 5 life and spare each other opponent. They might not repay your kindness.`
Did you read the additional text on Mairsil and Equipment?
Yup..."friends"
Love it
Yeah I run well of knowledge in Multani, Maro-Sorcerer specifically to incite my opponents to spend mana chasing the pink dragon. It works frequently.
